Activity: Arrive at the office. Check emails and calendar for urgent matters. Prioritize tasks based on urgency and impact.
Review the summary report sent to the COO and CIO last night. Note any feedback or questions.
Browse Wall Street Journal and Bloomberg for market news and relevant regulatory updates. Identify any potential impacts on the project.
Review submitted SMART goals from team members. Identify any that are unclear, unrealistic, or misaligned with project objectives.
Send follow-up emails to team members whose SMART goals require clarification or revision. Provide specific feedback and guidance.
Prepare a consolidated report of all team members' SMART goals. Highlight any potential dependencies or conflicts between teams.
Lunch. Discuss potential investment strategies with @qres-1, @qres-2 and @qres-3.
Research UHNWI investment preferences and trends. Identify potential marketing strategies for the fund. @mkt-1
Schedule a meeting with @legal-1 and @comp-1 to discuss SEC regulations and compliance requirements for the fund registration process.
Prepare agenda for meeting with @legal-1 and @comp-1, focusing on key regulatory milestones, required documentation, and potential compliance risks.
Update project plan with finalized SMART goals, dependencies, and resource allocation for each team.
Send a progress update email to COO and CIO summarizing the status of SMART goal finalization, upcoming meetings with team leads, and the meeting with legal and compliance.
Finalize daily tasks and prepare for tomorrow's schedule.
